page.title: 15Life in an Old People's Home
page.content: Life in an Old People's Home is different. At{Wilfred Geere House}the nurses have to work very hard to prevent accidents because many of the 35 residents(7 men & 28 women) need a lot of attention; 8 are in wheelchairs 7 can only walk with a Zimmer frame, 4 are blind and l7 are incontinent. 10 are over 90 years old. The oldest is a lady of 98 and the youngest is a man of 72. There are l7 bedrooms(6 single) so most people have to share a room. For most of the day the old people sit and talk or watch TV in one of the lounges. In the evenings they play bingo or dominoes. On Wednesdays there is a handicrafts class & Saturday is sports day on TV which the men enjoy. There is a very long waiting list and the only way to get a place at the home is if someone dies. Peter Allsop.
